description.narrative: By the end of 2017, a system for collecting and managing data between the central and sub prefectural levels to track birth registration, violence, exploitation and abuse against to girls and boys is regularly informed by the community-based protection mechanism information is used for decision making,, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end of 2017, 60% of children (girls and boys), adolescents and women, particularly the most vulnerable in priority intervention areas, enjoy adequate protection against exploitation, abuse, violence and benefit from socio-professional reintegration birth registration is improved from 43 to 70% FGM/C, early pregnancies and child marriages under 15 are reduced by 5% and 15% for those under 18.

description.narrative: UNICEF pursued the generation of evidence for better understanding of determinants of child marriage and of the impact of strategies used to influence the abandonment of female genital mutilation. The collection of routine data on child protection remains challenging. Most data on children are collected on an ad hoc basis | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2017
